intro: Hoffmannseggella kettieana, commonly known as Kettie's hoffmannseggella, is a flowering plant species native to the Andes Mountains in South America. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in high-altitude environments, thriving in cool, moist conditions. Its leaves are narrow and grass-like, while its flowers are small and clustered, often displaying shades of yellow and white. Hoffmannseggella kettieana is of interest to botanists due to its unique adaptations to its alpine habitat.
